IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIMARY EXEMPT PURPOSE IS TO AWARD GRANTS FOR (A) THE DELIVERY OF CIVIL LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO THE POOR AND DISADVANTAGED IN PENNSYLVANIA BY NON-PROFIT CORPORATIONS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986, AS AMENDED; (B) THE DELIVERY OF CIVIL LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO THE POOR AND DISADVANTAGED IN PENNSYLVANIA BY CLINICAL AND INTERNSHIP PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY LAW SCHOOLS LOCATED IN PENNSYLVANIA; AND (C) THE ADMINISTRATION OF JUSTICE IN PENNSYLVANIA.
IRS990.Desc: FACILITATE AND AWARD GRANTS FOR THE DELIVERY OF CIVIL LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO THE POOR AND DISADVANTAGED IN PENNSYLVANIA BY NON-PROFIT CORPORATIONS DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE OF 1986, AS AMENDED.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: FACILITATE AND AWARD GRANTS FOR THE DELIVERY OF CIVIL LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO THE POOR AND DISADVANTAGED IN PENNSYLVANIA BY CLINICAL AND INTERNSHIP PROGRAMS ADMINISTERED BY LAW SCHOOLS LOCATED IN PENNSYLVANIA.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: A LOAN REPAYMENT ASSISTANCE PROGRAM (LRAP) WAS ESTABLISHED TO HELP LEGAL SERVICES ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROVIDE CIVIL LEGAL ASSISTANCE TO POOR PENNSYLVANIANS WITHOUT CHARGE, ATTRACT AND RETAIN QUALIFIED ATTORNEYS. THE ORGANIZATIONS WERE FINDING THAT ATTORNEYS, WHO WISHED TO BE EMPLOYED AT PUBLIC SERVICE, COULD NOT AFFORD TO DO SO BECAUSE OD THE VERY LARGE AMOUNT OF STUDENT DEBT THEY HAD ACCUMULATED. A GRANT WAS MADE TO THE PENNSYLVANIA BAR FOUNDATION (PBF), A 501(C)(3) TAX EXEMPT ORGANIZATION, TO ADMINISTER THE LRAP. ATTORNEYS WHO ARE EMPLOYED BY ANY IOLTA FUNDED QUALIFIED LEGAL AID ORGANIZATION CAN APPLY TO THE PBF FOR A FORGIVABLE LOAN AND MAY PARTICIPATE FOR UP TO 10 YEARS. THE AMOUNT OF ANNUAL ASSISTANCE WILL DEPEND PRIMARILY ON THE AMOUNT OF AVAILABLE FUNDING AND THE NUMBER OF QUALIFYING ATTORNEY APPLICANTS. AN ATTORNEY WILL BE ELIGIBLE FOR LRAP ASSISTANCE IF: (I) HIS/HER TOTAL CURRENT ANNUAL GROSS SALARY IS LESS THAN OR EQUAL TO $66,000; OR (II) IF HIS/HER ANNUAL NET DEBT SERVICE IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO 10% OF HIS/HER TOTAL CURRENT ANNUAL GROSS SALARY, REGARDLESS OF THE TOTAL ANNUAL SALARY AMOUNT. THEY MUST ALSO REMAIN EMPLOYED IN GOOD STANDING WITH THE LEGAL AID ORGANIZATION FOR ONE FULL YEAR AND REMAIN IN GOOD STANDING WITH THEIR LENDERS FOR ALL OF THEIR STUDENT LOANS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROCEDURES FOR MONITORING THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS GRANTEES ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT NARRATIVE AND FINANCIAL REPORTS QUARTERLY, OR TWICE ANNUALLY. THE GRANTS MANAGER AND EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR REVIEW EVERY REPORT TO ENSURE THAT THEY ARE USING THE MONEY FOR THE PURPOSE AND WITHIN THE BUDGET STATED IN THEIR PROPOSAL. INQUIRIES ARE MADE IF THE REPORTS ARE UNCLEAR OR SEEM INCONSISTENT WITH THEIR PROPOSAL. PAIOLTA CONDUCTS SITE VISITS, RELIES ON PLAN, INC. TO MONITOR THE GRANTEE'S PROGRAMS, AND ALSO RECEIVES A COPY OF THE MONITORING REPORTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: A COPY WILL BE SENT TO EACH BOARD MEMBER FOR REVIEW BEFORE BEING FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORMS COMPLETED BY EACH BOARD MEMBER AT SEPTEMBER BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: 15A: COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR TOP OFFICIAL SALARY IS COMPARED TO IOLTA DIRECTORS IN OTHER STATES. 15B: COMPENSATION PROCESS FOR OTHER OFFICERS OR KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION INVOLVES A REVIEW BY THE ADMINISTRATIVE OFFICE OF PENNSYLVANIA COURTS (AOPC) AND UTILIZATION OF THE UNIFIED JUDICIAL SYSTEM (UJS) PAY-BAND; APPROPRIATE PAY BANDS (WITH SALARY RANGES) ARE ASSIGNED BASED ON EMPLOYEE JOB TITLE AND DUTIES PERFORMED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
